subject: Mental Health
title: Emil Kraepelin and Classification
description: A short lesson to help you apply Emil Kraepelin and Classification.

hook.text: Before Kraepelin, every psychiatrist had a different name for the same illness.

buildup.text: In the 1890s, Emil Kraepelin systematically classified mental disorders by their course.

discovery.text: He distinguished manic depression from dementia praecox â€” now called bipolar and schizophrenia.

twist.text: His classification system became the foundation for the DSM used worldwide today.

climax.text: For the first time, psychiatrists could communicate using a shared language.

punchline.text: You can't treat what you can't name.

quiz.question: What did Kraepelin contribute to psychiatry?
